result.execSummary:
The defendant David M. Gasca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David M. Gasca is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David M. Gasca was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail to commence FORTHWITH.  DNA sample to be provided. DE comply with registration requirements for 10 years in WI from conviction date.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant David M. Gasca in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion regarding sex offender registration.  Atty. Dolch makes statement of how long would DE have to register as S.O.  Dept. of IL S.O.R. finally got back, that will be mandatory lifetime registration in IL.  State understands this as well. State spoke with victim and they don't want to make further statement on this issue.  State states DE should register.  Court questions discretion of how long to register.  Atty. Dolch makes statement - not register in WI since IL is lifetime and he will be going back there after release from jail 4/15/17.  Court rules as follows - DE comply with registration requirements for 10 years in WI from conviction date.
to exempt from Sex Offender Registration Requirements

Judge Screnock verbally approved Atty Dolch's request to extend the deadline until January 20, 2017 to file the motion regarding sex offender registration.  JA informed Atty Dolch by telephone of the approval.
Cover Letter from atty. Dolch

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on February 20, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David M. Gasca in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Defendant David M. Gasca in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hoffman states recommendations.  Atty Dolch notes probation was considered but DE lives in IL and it's unlikely that would be possible.  Cash bond would be applied as there is $2,000 cash already posted in this matter.  State notes victim was notified and there is a VIS for the parties to review.  Parties review VIS.  Atty Dolch enters NC plea.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea.  DE advised of felony firearms warnings.  Parties discuss sex offender registration.  Recess for parties to discuss registration requirements.  Back on the record, State requests reset due to victim being allowed to make a statement re: registration.  Parties would then have a change to investigate a possible joint recommendation re: registration.  Atty Dolch agrees and addresses possible evaluation.  Prefers to proceed to sentencing today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on his understanding re: registration possibly being for lifetime.  DE understands.  Court accepts plea and finds DE guilty on Count 1.  Count 2 is dismissed.  State makes statement re: recommendations.  Court questions DE re: waiver of a PSI.  DE waives PSI.  Court accepts waiver of PSI.  Atty Dolch makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE reads statement to the Court.  Court sentences.  Motion for 2/20/2017 hearing to be filed no later than 2/13/2017.

Ct 1:  NC
6 months jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
To commence FORTHWITH
19 days credit to be applied
$518.00.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan w/Clerk's office
DNA sample to be provided
Cash bond to be applied - remaining bond to be returned to whomever posted it
Ct 2:  Dismissed
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant David M. Gasca by video from LEC with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Defendant David M. Gasca in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE transferred from prison in Illinois to Sauk County Jail.  State requests $10,000 cash bond.  Atty Dolch requests reinstatement of previous cash bond or $200 cash bond.  Atty Dolch requests no unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18.  $10,000.00 Cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with females under the age of 18 except for supervised contact with family members.  No contact with H.M.B.

Likely to withdraw interstate detainer.  State also request PTC.  Attorney Dolch to file letter regarding detainer status.  Matter remains on for trial.
